source_name: Library of Congress - African American Oral Histories
description: The Library of Congress American Folklife Center houses extensive oral history collections documenting African American experiences from the Great Migration through contemporary times. Includes the Civil Rights History Project, Veterans History Project (African American veterans), and StoryCorps collections. These first-person narratives provide invaluable perspectives on lived experiences, community organizing, cultural traditions, and social movements.

restrictions: Must respect interviewee privacy and release agreements
No commercial use without explicit permission
Educational and research use generally permitted
license.notes: Each oral history has specific usage terms. The Library of Congress is the steward but does not always hold copyright. Users must review individual item rights statements.

known_issues: Transcription quality varies by project and era
Some audio files lack complete transcripts
Metadata inconsistency across different collection periods
data_lineage: Metadata creation by LOC staff and volunteers

contact.organization: Library of Congress - American Folklife Center

change_history.changes: Initial manifest creation with review from oral history specialists

related_sources.description: Oral histories provide personal narratives that complement official government records
Some StoryCorps content is housed at LOC

notes: Oral histories require special handling due to their narrative structure and personal nature. Chunking should preserve context and speaker attribution. Consider implementing speaker diarization for multi-person interviews. Priority should be given to fully transcribed interviews with complete metadata.
